title: Opportunity Insights: Neighborhood Characteristics
description: This data provides multiple levels (census tract, county, and conmmunity zone) covariates used throughout the paper or shown in the Opportunity Atlas as neighborhood characteristics. All variables other than czname are numeric. The statistics reported in this table have been cleared by the Census Bureau's Disclosure Review Board release authorization number CBDRB-FY18-319.
creator: Opportunity Insights
subject: Demographics
Economic Stability
Employment
Education
Housing
Social and Community Context
methods_variables: ‘Average annualized job growth rate’, ‘rate of employment computed as total

employed population’, ‘Number of foreign born residents’, ‘Number of people aged 25 or older who have a bachelor's degree, master's degree, professional school degree, or doctorate degree’, ‘Number of jobs with earnings greater than $3,333 per month in own and neighboring tracts whose centroids fall within a radius of 5 miles’, ‘Total number of jobs in own and neighboring tracts whose centroids fall within a radius of 5 miles’, ‘Wage growth for high school graduates’, ‘2010 Census return rate’, ‘Mean commute time for workers over 16 years old’, ‘Share of individuals in the tract below the federal poverty line’, ‘Number of residents per square mile’, ‘The median gross rent for renter-occupied housing units with two bedrooms that pay cash rent’, ‘Racial Shares’, ‘The number of households with females heads (and no husband present) or male heads (and no wife present) with own children under 18 years old present’, ‘Share of workers 16 years and over who do not work at home whose commute is shorter than 15 minutes’, ‘Wharton Residential Land Use Regulatory Index’
data_variables: ‘Total population 16 years and over’, ‘Sum of native and foreign born residents’, ‘total number of people aged 25 or older’, ‘Mean 3rd grade math test scores’, ‘Mean household income’, ‘Median household income’, ‘Number of jobs per square mile’
